author: {'steamid': '76561198408668339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1559346993}
review:
Ugyanaz a lényege mint az eredeti Slendernek, vagyis papírokat kell gyűjtögetni egy hatalmas pályán.
De ezúttal nem csak elfutni hanem harcolni is tudunk a szörnyek ellen(nekik dobva a tárgyakat),mindenfajta vicces fegyverekkel pl.:tűzcsap,üdítő,vécécsésze stb.Kiiktatásuk után pénz kapunk amit elkölthetünk automatáknál életre és töltényre.Különösebb probléma nincsen a játékkal el lehet szórakozni vele ideig óráig,egyetlen dolog ami picit idegesítő hogy könnyű eltévedni a pályán ami elég nagy,de ezen kívül nincsen bajom vele.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1518319291}
review:
"Lost in a Forest" ist eine Slender-Parodie.

Wie im Original dürfen wir in einem Waldgebiet an bestimmten Orten einzelne Seiten finden. Sobald wir das erste Stück Papier aufgesammelt haben, taucht immer wieder eine Art Slenderman auf, den wir, wie im Original, möglichst nicht lange anschauen sollten, sonst hat das negative Auswirkungen auf unsere Gesundheit.

Der große Unterschied zum Original: wir sind nicht wehrlos. Wir können die Slendermänner bewerfen. Mit allem was wir so finden: Coladosen aus Automaten, Feuerlöschern, Autoreifen, Katzen oder ganzen Klos. Besiegte Gegner lassen Geldbündel fallen, mit denen wir uns an Coladosenautomaten wieder neue Coladosen kaufen können.

Technisch ist das Game ein schwaches Unity-Spielchen wie man es kennt und nur allzu oft zu Gesicht bekommen hat. 

Das grundlegende Problem: das Spiel ist nur bedingt komisch. Auch wenn einige Ideen ganz nett sein mögen, wie etwa ein tanzender Slenderman, den man in einem Haus findet, ist das Spiel im Kern und fast die ganze Spielzeit doch nichts anderes als eine mäßige Slender-Variante mit schwachem Pacing. Daß ich mit Klos werfen kann, reizt bei mir jetzt noch nicht direkt das Komikzentrum. Eher läßt es einen eine Augenbraue heben.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
5/10 Atmosphäre
4/10 Story
5/10 Grafik
5/10 Sound
5/10 Spielmechanik
5/10 Balancing
5/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Ich bewerf Dich mit nem Klo, du Slender du.

[h1][b]5/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 1183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1502684301}
review:
Tags: 1PHWS - First P. Horror Walk Sim
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Random assets. Limited field of vision. No exposition or intro. easter egg hut collection gameplay. Little to no horror.

There is no intro. No plot. You are dumped in an absolutely massive area, full of barren empty land with ugly grass texture and the same dead tree asset spawned over and over. Visibility radius is low and there is a constant white filter in the middle of the screen, kind of like a flashlight being activated except it does not light anything up and is just a faint distracting white layer on top of the rendered images. Random assets are sprinkled about the forest. Cola cans, food, but also tires, pumpkins, toilet sinks... You collect them because they glow as pickable items. Ultimate goal is to find pages I think because its part of the on-screen information but I never saw one. The mouse sensitivity is very high and there are no options menu so using a hardware solution is mostly required. The game is very confusing to navigate because of the poor map design. I was following signs and what vaguely looked like a path because no trees grew on it. I sprinted whenever i recovered stamina and even after 12+ minutes I still had not reach the church which was one of the landmarks on the signs. Occasionally you get a jumpscare but they are very rare, I have seen two, one of which looked like it was unfinished and it lasted very briefly to kind of hide that. I am assuming that you would have to use collected items at landmarks to unlock a thing to do a thing to end the game but I started picking multiple copies of the same items and that kind of confused me. In any case there is no parody here, just really feels like someone seriously was going to make a horror walking sim, and early in the process gave up and just did the bare minimum to put what little work they had put in together in something that vaguely ressembles a game. And then could not keep a straight face and ask for money so decided to just declare it a parody.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060897854', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1483820523}
review:
I see why comedy is a tag for this "game"

its basically a walking simulator where you pick up items varrying from a potato gun, gas tanks, a toilet, jack-o-lantern, a green eyed cat and so on and so forth

the only decent weapon i have found is the potato gun which wont save you for long

the only objective you have is getting 7 pages, after finding one in this pretty huge map you are instantly bombarded with creepy fan-made slenderman looking people that instantly damage your health when they spawn. You keep getting bombarded until you die. I dont see how this is possible, after 20+minutes of mindless exploring I found one page. 

If you're really scraping the bottom of the barrel for indie games you can check this out for a good laugh. 

slenderman clones need to die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029648113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1475912818}
review:
The good: Shoot Slenderman in the crotch.

The bad: The rest.

I feel this game either should have tried to be all the way goofy, or all the way serious. Both would have been funnier, and more tolerable than the middle ground it found itself in. I can ignore the technical issues if the game was fun. But I personally did not find it so. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8jpl_8yy59c

author: {'steamid': '76561198088763476', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1526758532}
review:
JEU QUI PARODIE LES JEUX D'HORREURS :

Le but de Lost in a Forest est très simple, trouver 7 pages cachées dans la forêt. Mais évidemment notre cher ami Slender va essayer de nous y empêcher. Pour le contrer, on peut lui balancer des canettes, des briques, des chats et même des toilettes !!! 

Et l'intérêt du jeu est là ! Pouvoir balancer à la face de Slender tout ce que l'on peut trouver est très fun et plutôt marrant. 

Pour 1€50 le jeu vaut le coup mais il faut s'attendre à un jeu parodique et non un jeu d'horreur.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216083204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1445609057}
review: My first horror/adventure was penumbra and needless to say, (but will any way), I was hooked to the genre. When I first played slender man with my sister we had a fairly good time. This game doesn't even come close to the standards set forth by the penumbra series or even by ,the less creative but still OK ,slender man game. My main complaint concering the graphics was the setting which was suppose to be this scary forest. Well it wasn't scary and what's more it barely passed as a forest. It revealed to me how unimaginative the developer(s) are as well as their knowledge or lack of what makes a successful horror/adventure game. Another complaint I have is the game's lack of originality in other words it has been done there is no need to create the same game over and over again. My advice is to be inspired by other games not copy them, you know take what has been done and  go to the next level ,think outside the box, do what hasn't been done yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020622895', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1441226061}
review:
What a lackluster title. Lost in a forest is a game that boasts finally being able to fight back against the ghosts and ghouls you run from in other games. Taking up the setting commonly found in games like the slender the game certainly delivers upon it's promise. Very comedically. Your aresenal runs from soda cans to toilets. Every enemy is a one hit kill with any item so having such a wide range of items is for the gamers pleasure I suppose although most of time you'll be gunning soda cans and bricks as they are the most common items in the game. As far as the horror aspect goes it's pretty much non existent similar to the threat of anything you seemingly only lose health when you look at the enemies which are all poorly modeled tall characters with no descernable traits other than being tall. But as I said you only have to hit them once with anything and they die so it's really no big deal. The poor combat and gameplay aside what this game has you do is wander around the forest for seemingly no reason with signs pointing to different locales like a warehouse and other such things. The only building I found was a shed after finding that I found nothing for the duration of my time playing this game. So essentially the name of the game is wandering aimlessly through a poorly laid out forest blasting the monsters out of your way with random junk and that's it. The game certainly leaves a lot to be desired and quite frankly I could expect no more out of a low budget comedy title. The game really loses it's comedy charm about 3 minutes in leaving you with nothing more than monotonous boring chore gameplay. So unless you can pick this game up for somewhere along the lines of 25-30 cents like I did I wouldn't suggest picking it up at all. 4/10 pretty boring... If you would like to see some gameplay here is a link.
https://youtu.be/rMrwsrdLwoY

author: {'steamid': '76561198083400292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1432915169}
review: Lost In a Forest.Proviamolo.Che dire...sarebbe una "Parodia" di Slender Man, io non sono mai stato appassionato di Slender Man anche se sono un FAN degli horror, però io non me lo sono giocato sopratutto per il fatto che non mi fa paura lo Slender..ma tornando a noi.Lost In a Forest presenta la stessa identica storia di Slender Man e le stesse meccaniche, ma questo gioco presenta dei fattori non presenti su Slender Man: 1 Durante il gioco potrete raccogliere/comprare oggetti da tirare contro il mostro quindi potrete difendervi dal mostro e/o farlo andare via.2 Questo gioco presenta più Modelli in controfonto di Slender Man, con più di 4 modelli: 1 Slender Man, 2 Triste Mietitore 3 Slender/CAVALLO 4 Slender Man terrorista.3 Da quello che ho potuto notare l'ambientazione è più ampia e aperta rispetto a Slender Man "The Arrival".Quindi,Parodia di Slender Man malriuscita?..Nhaaa,anzi, è molto meglio del originale! 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198053208728', 'num_games_owned': 873, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1432872241}
review:
Well, I don't like to sh*t-talk things, so I'm going to say that I enjoy the idea of a game where you can throw toilets, and the first time you throw a weapon at one of the monsters chasing you it's a little satisfying.

Aside from that, I can't say much positive about the game. The game feels like it most certainly didn't mean to be a parody; it feels like they finished the game and realized that it wad too generic to have any else marketable or mildly unique (which the game, at this point, sadly isn't). The game play is uninspired, the graphics are as bland as lukewarm water and the actual mechanics of the game are - again - very generic. This game might as well be a workshop pack for Slender, but Slender was at least atmospheric. The compass gets cut off by some aspect ratios in windowed mode, you cant sprint again after depleting your stamina until it is entirely full, and the map is a big pile of almost-identical textures.

3.5/10, not only wouldn't recommend but would also actively recommend against it. i kind of want to apologise to the single person who made this game, but he/she should really have tried to make something that is either A) an actual parody, or B) not so (and again I'm sorry to keep using this word)damn generic.

TL;DR, This game feels more like a thinly-veiled ripoff than a parody. It's uninspired and fun for about ten minutes, but they aren't the first ten minutes. The game is a bumblef*ck, I'm sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177869325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1430945761}
review:
This game sucks.

[ITA Review]

Videogameplay\recensione: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6v4E9IBTax0

Un'autentica merda. Siamo convinti che originariamente questo gioco non è stato concepito come parodia, ma che lo sviluppatore - Konsordo (ma che nome è?) - durante lo sviluppo si sia reso conto che dal suo "duro impegno" stava venendo su un abominio colossale, per cui ha fatto la paraculata d'inserire quattro robe fuori luogo per far passare questo scempio come "parodia". 

Grafica - Non c'è niente da dire: è brutta e spoglia, mentre i modelli 3D sono quasi tutti privi di animazioni. 

Suono - Anche qui il minimo sindacale. In altre parole: "ci sono i suoni", fine.

Gameplay - Si può correre, e la cosa diminuisce di un pochino un'eventuale lentezza che avrebbe reso questo gioco non semplicemente inconcepibile, ma inaccettabile. La "parodia" sta nel fatto che le armi sono oggetti fuori luogo raccolti nel bosco e che si possono lanciare contro i mostri, che quest'ultimi quando muoiono lasciano i soldi alla GTA maniera e che non c'inseguono restando immobili e limitandosi ad apparire e guardarci danneggiandoci semplicemente standoci vicino? 
Ha-ha-ha, un divertimento assicurato.

Longevità - 1h.

Già dopo 10 minuti si capisce che questo gioco è uno schifo, ed è inaccettabile che si debba anche pagare. L'abbiamo preso in offerta a 75 centesimi, ma resta comunque un'ingiustizia: questa feccia, di centesimo, non ne merita neanche uno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219059088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1431311295}
review: How long did it take to pump out this piece of shit?  First the player is spawned in with no instructions.  Then I guess your'e just supposed to wander around untill you get bored enough and stop playing.  Apparently, you can actually fight back, that is, if you can actually figure out how.  Parody or not, this game is shit and is not worth the price.  The developer should pay people to play this mOTHER FUCKING PIECE OF GODDAMN SHIT!  Have a nice day! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198047700284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1431294773}
review:
Recommended, but this game needs a lot of work.  Most of the time I was just wandering around farming Slendy, the Grim Reaper, and Camel-headed Slendy while completely lost.  The game has a decent environment; I like the shape of the trees, the helpful glow of throwable items, and the variety of items.  But getting to the items (via mouse scroll) is almost impossible, making you overshoot the item you need.  

Once you get going, you don't die (hint: aim the HUD at the heal kits in the vending machines to heal), at least not easily, and I quit out of frustration and being lost rather than fear or death.  Life and Stamina meters are a godsend - thank you!  The on-board compass and ingame 'maps' (map? it's literally just a field with 'you are here' on it :T ) are nice, but give us a little bit more.  I'd like to know that walking in one direction forever will eventually get me somewhere.

Devs, please - put more than one sound on the footsteps.  That sickening grass/gravel crunch turns my stomach.  The ambient noises are really good, though - that howling/screaming one was just creepy!  An overall story would be GOLDEN.  You have a lot of room for great parody, here.  USE IT!

I do not believe the church exists.  There are signs for it, but I've never seen it. :T

Calm down that mouse sensitivity as well.  It's bad.  I waste more potatoes shooting trees than creeps.  But I love the ragdoll physics used (the truck tire is certainly worth using!), and dropping Slendy & friends is quite satisfying.

GUYS - THIS GAME IS SCARIER THAN IT LETS ON.  I was walking after getting the second page and out of nowhere some gray body/face/screaming thing popped on screen in line with my HUD.  Made me jump a damn mile!  Jump scares are all right, but the scary noises and ambience is even better.

Good cheap game, nice if you're too freaked by Slender.  Worth the $0.99 I put into it, but with some work it could be worth a lot more.  Definitely has potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009526542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1427623529}
review:
Disons le tout de suite, ce jeu vaut les 1.50€ qu'il coûte.

Les graphismes sont basiques, l'ambiance sonore en plus d'être répetitive est moyenne.

Le gameplay est simple, et facile, rien de bien compliqué. Le jeu porte très bien son nom, on spawn dans une forêt/cimetierre et on se perd facilement... Après quelques heur...minutes on trouve un panneau, une carte ou son premier objets à jeter à la tête des méchants !!!

L'interêt de ce jeu, c'est que c'est une parodie de "Slender The arrival", ou votre objectif en plus trouver les 7 pages, est de survivre. Survivre oui, mais avec la possibilité de tabasser les divers monstres qui vous attaque !!!

Au choix, des extincteurs, roues de tracteurs, toilettes, lanceur de balles de baseball... 
Bref, c'est fun, les bruitages des attaques avec les objets sont excellents et c'est l'interêt.

Il a été assez mal noté car peu on compris qu'il s'agissait d'un jeu fun parodique et non d'un jeu d'horreur, pourtant moi qui l'ai acheté en sachant à quoi m'attendre, je ne regrette pas cet investissement ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561197969089433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1429532994}
review:
・お値段からいってもご贈答に最適で、カードも排出されるので先方にも喜ばれます。
・ゲームプレイにも難しいところは一切無く、システムは単純明快。森のどこかにある七枚の紙を集めるだけで、ストーリーは一切ありません。
・クリアまで1～2時間とちょっとした時間でクリア可能。
・小難しい実績の類はありませんから、一度クリアすればそれだけで完全に崩したといえます。
・ホラーゲームのように見える方もいらっしゃるかもしれませんが、ホラータグはついてないのでホラーではありません。
・君がほしがってる森ってこれだろ？　と軽い気持ちでフレンドに放り投げてより親密な中になりましょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052516262', 'num_games_owned': 1897, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1502565086}
review: There isn't much to say about this title. It's exactly as the title suggests, you are "lost in a forest". This game is incredibly predictable. Nothing new to the drawing board. Does not remake the mold. Feels like a game you would find on GameJolt for free. I call my self an "Achievement Whore" and not even this game is worth it. Now I did play the game to completion, which should take maybe an hour (hopefully less), but I did not enjoy, got no satisfaction from beating it, and as one who has played many awful retro games, the end is exactly as expected (You are Winner). Do not buy for more than possibly .20 USD. and even then its not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061420845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1425833609}
review: A good horror game, remembers me everytime when playing this game of the old PewDiePie. It's not to harsh to play it like Outlast might seem, it's a very good adition to your Horror Games library. It's nice because it keeps you always up and ready for anything, not too spooky when you realise most of the things that happened were just in your mind. Stil, there are some parts when it just scares the shit out of you, so I can say it's worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026822122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1423531547}
review:
Für die paar Cent ein echt spaßiges Spiel, viel besser als es die bisherigen Reviews vermuten lassen. 
Man bewirft die Monster mit allem was man im Wald findet, das sind Autoreifen, miauende Katzen, Benzinkanister, Feuerlöscher, Kloschüsseln, alles mögliche.

Jedes getroffene Monster lässt ein Bündel Geld fallen, dafür kann man in den Warehouses, die aussehen wie Getränkeautomaten und an den verschiedenen Stationen stehen, Coladosen kaufen, mit denen man die Monster auch bewerfen kann. Dadurch bekommt man keinen Munitionsmangel, denn Coladosen hat man immer genügend eingesteckt.

Es gibt neun verschiedene Stationen an denen eine Karte versteckt ist, diese Karten gilt es auch einzusammeln, der Fortschritt wird am oberen Bildschirmrand eingeblendet.

Das klingt nach einem gemütlichen Spaziergang, doch ganz soo leicht ist es wiederum nicht, beim ersten Try bin ich gestorben und wusste nicht warum. Ganz einfach, man muss die Monster so schnell wie möglich niederhaun, umso länger sie einen anblicken, desto leerer wird die Lebensleiste. 
Den Lebensbalken kann man sich auch bei einem "Getränkeautomaten" wieder voll auffüllen.

Alles in allem ein sehr einfach gestricktes, aber dennoch gut unterhaltendes Spiel für zwischendurch. Etwas aufwendig ist, das man die verschiedenen Wurfgeschosse nur durch Scrollen mit der Maus auswählen kann, was mitunter schon sehr mühsam ist, bis man das gewünschte Teil gefunden hat. 
Wenn man das nächste Monster zb mit einer schreienden Katze erschlagen möchte empfiehlt es sich, diese vorab auszuwählen und in die Hand zu nehmen. Wenn das Monster bereits vor einem steht, macht es keinen Sinn sich durch Rumscrollen auf die Suche nach der Katze zu machen. Denn wie gesagt, die Blicke des Monsters saugen einem den Lebensbalken leer, so eine Suche kann schnell tödlich enden. 
Tastaturkürzel wären da sicher vorteilhaft, damit könnte man viel schneller switchen.

Das Spiel wird einen wahrscheinlich nicht stundenlang vor dem PC fesseln, aber dennoch ist ein gelungenes und spaßiges Mini-Game, mehr kann man für das kleine Geld auch wirklich nicht erwarten.

Während ich es gespielt habe, sind keinerlei Bugs oder Spielabbrüche aufgetreten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052650942', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1422663280}
review:
This game sucks. Lame remake of slender, save your money it doesn't even worth this price.
Poor sound design, poor combat system (throwing soda cans and bricks on the immobiles monsters), not polished at all (Camera  moves when you're on the Esc Menu in game, clicking in the menu fire your current weapon). How can this game be on Steam ?!

Follow some tuto about Unity and you'll be able to make a better version of this game in few days. One day if you already know Unity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048240257', 'num_games_owned': 955, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1700886203}
review:
A crappy remake of Slender.

It's kind of creepy at first, but quickly gets boring. After getting the first page, you're basically screwed, because you'll have monsters constantly shoved in your face, which damage you instantly.

After 3 minutes of being bombarded with Slenderman's inbred cousins every 5 seconds, you'll die, and have to restart the game. All the weapons do the exact same thing, but they're completely useless, since just looking away from the monsters is enough to make them disappear.

I know this is only a $1.99 game, but it's seriously bad. It feels like the game was just thrown together in the Unity engine in about a week.

This game honestly shouldn't be on Steam

author: {'steamid': '76561197993698981', 'num_games_owned': 11065, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1424456082}
review:
For $2, almost made me shat my pants a couple of times.  

I have to say I recommend it, just keep your expectations on graphics and logic down.  Nothing makes sense.  It's like a horrible put-together-in-2-seconds kind of bad game but it does deliver on it's promises of being a horror game.  Some parts are freaky.  

I wish there was some direction on WTF do you even do?  I got 1 of howevermany pages and then all of a sudden I'm just haunted and somehow dying.  

Such a strange game, with a fair price, a welcome, but confusing addition to Steam.
